intro: Silene eremophila, commonly known as the desert pink, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its compact, cushion-like growth form, which helps it conserve water in harsh environments. The plant produces striking pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are small, hairy, and adapted to reduce water loss through transpiration. Silene eremophila is often found in rocky soils and is well-suited to survive in low-nutrient, drought-prone habitats.
